Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is light-brown in section, the interior is thickly encrusted with a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of three lines of red-painted cursive text and traces of a grey-black deposit.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394247) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394247)
